words.definition: If someone goes abroad, they go to another country.
words.example: My lady went abroad for a vacation.

words.definition: Anger is the shape of feeling that makes you want to hurt someone.
words.example: It didn't take much to create anger in him.

words.definition: A bride is a woman who is getting married or has just married.
words.example: The bride looked beautiful in her white dress.

words.definition: If something is brief, it only lasts for a short time.
words.example: The meeting was very brief.

words.definition: To chase someone or something is to follow them quickly in order to catch them.
words.example: I was chased by a dog.

words.definition: To disappoint is to make someone feel sad because something they expected did not happen.
words.example: I do not want to disappoint my family.

words.definition: To dive is to jump into water.
words.example: She will dive into the pool now.

words.definition: To exchange means to give something and get something else in return.
words.example: The men exchanged business cards.

words.definition: A favor is something you do to help someone.
words.example: Can you do me a favor?

words.definition: A fee is the money you pay for a service.
words.example: I had to pay an entrance fee.

words.definition: Forever means for all time.
words.example: We will be friends forever.

words.definition: A guy is a man.
words.example: He's a nice guy.

words.definition: When something is lovely, it is good-looking or beautiful.
words.example: The flowers are lovely.

words.definition: A mood is the way someone is feeling.
words.example: I am in a good mood.

words.definition: A palace is a very large house, typically where a king or queen lives.
words.example: The king and queen live in a beautiful palace.

words.definition: To permit something is to let it happen.
words.example: I was permitted to go home early.

words.definition: To protest is to show that you do not agree with something.
words.example: The people protested about the new law.

words.definition: A sculpture is a piece of art that is made out of stone, wood, or metal.
words.example: We saw an ancient sculpture at the museum.

words.definition: A tribe is a group of people who live in the same area and share the same culture.
words.example: The tribe lived in the jungle.

words.definition: Youth is the time in peopleâ€™s lives when they are young.
words.example: He played a lot of sports in his youth.
